title: [Self-directed] Sequential Programming Competency Development Course for Elementary Practitioners

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of introductory computing concepts and educational field experience
context.additional_context: A course for in-service elementary school teachers to acquire foundational programming competencies to strengthen science education. Combines theoretical learning with hands-on practice using digital devices (tablets/laptops).

learning_goals: Learners can write simple scientific experiment simulation code using block-based programming tools with over 80% accuracy.
Learners improve their ability to correct programming syntax errors by 30% after four or more iterative evaluations.
Learners can explain logical problem-solving procedures by subdividing them into three stages: analysis, design, and implementation.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
